mcts package¶

Submodules¶

mcts.MCTS_DecisionMaker module¶

class mcts.MCTS_DecisionMaker.MCTS_DecisionMaker(iteration_amount, c=1.4142135623730951)¶

Bases: gameflow.Client.DecisionMaker

A decision maker, that in this case uses the MCTS process.

make_decision() → gameflow.ActionsAndTurns.Action¶

Decides which action will be taken next.

mcts.MCTS_Node module¶

class mcts.MCTS_Node.Node(game_state: gamemodels.GameState.GameState, parent=None, action_used=None)¶

Bases: object

A node in the MCTS-tree.

average_reward() → float¶
backpropagate(winners, simulation: list, begin_simulation) → None¶

Backpropagate the outcome information back up the tree.

best_choice() → gameflow.ActionsAndTurns.Action¶

Concludes what the best action has been looking at the tree.

create_child(action: gameflow.ActionsAndTurns.Action)¶
expand() → None¶

Expands by taking the valid actions and transform them to other nodes and adding them to it’s children.

is_leaf_node() → bool¶
is_root_node() → bool¶
number_simulations_parent() → int¶

The total number simulations after the i-th move run by the parent node of the one considered.

select(c)¶

Select the most “interesting” node to explore. This can be because it gives a better score, or the opponent is more likely to choose because it results in a better score for him, or because it is more likely too happen because the dice throws this more often, or simply because it hasn’t been explored a lot yet.

simulate(timeout) -> (<class 'list'>, <class 'list'>)¶

Take semi-random action until the end of the game is reached, return the outcome.

ucb(c) → float¶

Upper Confidence Bound, used to create balance between exploitation and exploration. The bigger the result, the more “interesting” it is to explore this child.

visualize_tree(c, previous='') → str¶

Visualize the tree in the terminal.

mcts.MCTS_Node.domain_knowledge_weights(experiment: gamemodels.GameState.GameState, valid_actions: list) → list¶

Domain knowledge in Monte-Carlo simulations from https://www.researchgate.net/publication/220716999_Monte-Carlo_Tree_Search_in_Settlers_of_Catan Adding weights to certain actions so it more closely matches smarter play.

mcts.MCTS_Node.end_of_simulation(game_state: gamemodels.GameState.GameState, simulation: list) → gamemodels.GameState.GameState¶

When applying a list of actions to a gamestate, what will the outcome gamestate be.

mcts.MCTS_Node.multiple_max(lst, func)¶

Returns multiple items if it has a shared first place.

mcts.MCTS_Node.run_mcts(root_node: mcts.MCTS_Node.Node, iteration_amount: int, c: float, visualize_tree=False) → None¶

Run the Monte Carlo Tree Search process and iterate so many times.
